lead_paragraph: The chief, Michael J. Fahy, was part of a group responding to a building in the Kingsbridge neighborhood that was being investigated as a place where marijuana was being grown, officials said.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, J. David Goodman, Christine Hauser, Kate Pastor, Nikita Stewart and William K. Rashbaum.
byline.original: By ELI ROSENBERG and EMILY PALMER

headline.print_headline: Fire Dept. Battalion Chief Dies in Bronx Blast After Report of Gas Leak
headline.main: Fire Dept. Battalion Chief Killed in Bronx Explosion After Report of Gas Leak

snippet: The chief, Michael J. Fahy, was part of a group responding to a building in the Kingsbridge neighborhood that was being investigated as a place where marijuana was being grown, officials said....
abstract: New York Fire Dept Battalion Chief Michael J Fahy dies in explosion in Bronx after firefighters are alerted to gas smell at two-story house; investigators find signs of drug laboratory at scene.
